title: Is this Xerath change accurate?
body:
>Barrages that successfully hit enemy champions grant an extra barrage, up to a maximum.

This is part of the text that pops up when you hover over the Xerath icon in the update page. Is it accurate? It seems that there is no change like this on the PBE so I wanted to reaffirm that this change did ship/is shipping.

replies.body: Testing this change involves actually hitting a Xerath R, so we'll never know. :^)
Touche. ;) There're a lot of other little changes with his ultimate, including a slightly increased impact range. So you might see one or two more landing.

How about his Q? Has the cast time/hitbox changed? A Rioter mentioned that he feels "unfair", and indeed, his Q has a little longer range than the indicator shows. I can't find info on this, would appreciate a reply :) btw really happy about his ult change!

We tested a lot of things but found out there's actually not much wiggle room there.  We reduced the width by 5 units.  The warning beam indicator now draws slightly longer so it should actually overlap people it hits.
Thanks for the reply - now i will not get ppl raging in ALL chat for "that didn't hit me!!!" ;)
Xerath kinda feels weak late game...

Now that's something to look forward, even if it's a 1% increase.

Edit: a bit of clarification... we'll get 3 base shots and 1 more for each of those three hitting up to a max of 5 at max rank?
Unfortunately not. That model proved to be too volatile. You now get extra barrages at level 11 and 16.

Ok, thank you.

I do like this added reliability then because a "more shots reward" would have mean that Xerath would only bomb easy to hit targets which usually are not the ones to focus.
Yes

I've not seen the community ever give overwhelming feedback about Xerath other than "his ult looks like crap". I spend a *lot* of time on the Boards and yet I couldn't tell you a single thing Xerath players dislike about his kit other than his ult VFX/SFX. Don't think this one is on Riot.

The problem is that his ulti does look crap because most of his particles and animation are cobbled together for the rework. 

His Q animation is taken from his dominion capture animation, His W was his old ulti, his E is taken from Sydra's orbs for some reason and his ulti is brand new but it went through so many changes and was more lower damage and do as many shots as you can do till you run out of mana or get bored kinda thing and looked seriously [weak](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Usj1ScoWacI), but it got changed last minute to a nuking 3 shot thing like his old ulti. Once everyone said it looked weak Riot went ahead and simply made it bigger and left it at that, but the issue is is that most people will never be happy with the ultimate or it's particles I mean look at what people say about {{champion:136}}. I find it's a great ultimate with lots of utility and late game does so much damage that it has won team fights single handed once or twice but people think it isn't god like enough. 

In an ideal world they would give him a VU but it's unlikely as 

1. There are a whole host of champions that need it more *cough**cough* Rumble *cough*
2. His visuals are limited by the fact that he is mostly particles rather than model 
3. If history is anything to go by it aint likely simply because Xerath has always been the forgotten red headed step child 

What do i mean by that? well if you look at Xerath's history you will realize that he received one of the biggest buffs in the history of the game when Riot changed how MPEN worked in season 3 and nothing happened to Xerath until he got reworked. He's 3 years old but has only had 2 additional skins even though with the powerful elemental fantasy he has, he would surely be an prime candidate for PROGRAM, mecha and Master Arcanist skins. Hell why is he the only ascended champ that doesn't have a galactic skin I mean how hard can it be to have him charging up and throwing star matter at the enemy? Also why is he the only ascended not to have a unique interaction with {{champion:136}}? both are bound god like beings would have thought {{champion:136}} would have something to say, or is it because {{champion:101}} rips him apart? :p

but this minor rant is moot as if history is anything I'm not going to hold my breath that these things are going to happen

Personally, I think RIOT has the wrong approach on Xerath's ULT.  Overall, I think they are worried too much with range and not worried enough with actual design that has something to do with his lore overall.

It is 'nice' to have a few absurdly ranged shots now and then, but I doubt anyone actually plays Xerath for the Ult (I mean, taking the ult as a major factor in the kit). IMO, his ult should have the ammo mechanic and I will explain why.

I've posted somewhere else on the boards that the whole roots himself concept is outdated. I still do, but now I think it maybe renewed if (it will sound a little bit contradictory) it was closer to how it was before the rework.

Xerath's ult could be a toggle where he roots himself and has access to up to 3 to 5 CHARGES (levels 1 to 3) of Power Overwhelming (or any other name). Press R to root and unlock the charges and click to move to uproot.

What could he do with those charges? Primarily, shoot them more or less like he does now. The only change here is that if he decides to move, the remaining charges are not lost. They recharge one at a time and would be designed in a way that he more or less always has a charge but takes a while to have all charges available. 

Second use, and here is where things actually make sense lorewise. Since Xerath is trying to escape his prison, his Power Overwhelming Charges would represent his outbursts of energy while trying to break free (the number of charges available at later levels showing how close he is to breaking free). And how he uses those outbursts (besides artillery)? By modifying his other skills. Xerath's kit is not disabled while Ulting, but any other skill he uses consumes a charge of Power Overwhelming for and additional effect (and not damage, unless his kit becomes too lightweight there). Like, using an Arcanopulse while Ulting? Max Range, no charge time, grants speed after Xerath uproots. Use an Eye of Destruction while Ulting? Eye of Destruction gains a few extra units of range and leaves an area of slow for a few seconds. I confess I have not thought of an empowered Shocking Orb, but I think someone can come up with a nice idea here.

Just my thoughts. Cya.
